item.description: This form can cause flakey tests: from django import forms from django.

item.title: How to override Django's settings for every method in a test class
item.description: Django’s override_settings decorator only works on functions and methods in subclasses of unittest.

item.title: That Python's `datetime` package doesn't support ordinal suffixes for the day of the month
item.description: Django’s date template filter (and underlying django.utils.dateformat module) support using S as a format character for the English ordinal suffix for the day of the month.

item.title: You can't use Django's generic foreign key field with objects stored in a separate database
item.description: Django supports using separate databases for specified models or apps.

item.title: About Django's `setup` method for generic view classes
item.description: Django 2.2 (released in April 2019) introduced a setup method to the django.

item.title: Django settings prefixed with an underscore are private
item.description: As in: you can’t access them from outside the settings module.

item.title: Django doesn't flush caches between tests
item.description: This is slightly counter-intuitive as it’s different to how databases are treated by the test runner.
